item.title: Handling Redirects in Nuxt.js through Middleware
item.description: We can utilise the serverMiddlware provided out of the box with Nuxt.js to read a JSON file and handle the redirects for our application.

item.title: Handling Redirects in a Laravel Application
item.description: Most websites will need to manage their redirects at some point. For this, we're going to utilise a Spatie package to read redirects from a configuration file and/or a database table.

item.title: Awesome Laravel Nova Packages to Get You Started
item.description: A collection of five packages to kickstart your next project with Laravel Nova. These are some of my personal favourites that I use on every project.

item.title: Moving to Figma
item.description: I recently moved my web design workflow away from Sketch & Adobe XD to Figma full time. Here I'll cover the reasons why it works for me, and how it could for you.

item.title: Working on Local Packages in Laravel with Composer
item.description: Working on Packages for Laravel in a local environment can be a little annoying to start. Utilising Composer we can make this process as simple as cloning a repository.

item.title: Using Accessors and Mutators to Abstract Common Functionality within Laravel
item.description: Accessors and Mutators can help with abstracting common functionality in our application into one consistent location. By utilising them we can provide a more consistent codebase and improve the workflow between developers.

item.title: Laracon Online 2018
item.description: An overview of my personal highlights from the 2018 Laracon Online conference, including recaps of talks by Steve Schoger and Jonathan Reinink.

item.title: Setting Up A Windows 10 Development Environment with WSL, PHP & Laravel
item.description: Guide & Tutorial on setting up WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux) with a Laravel/PHP development stack for simplified coding on Windows 10.

item.title: Beautiful, organised results in PHPUnit
item.description: A small extension for PHPUnit to beautify and orgnaise tests. Where have you been?

item.title: An Introduction to WordPress Plugin Development
item.description: Plugins play a key part in how we handle WordPress builds and offer services to clients. This article involves a brief write up of how to get started building your own WordPress plugins.

item.title: Chrome 63 Forces Redirection of .dev Domains to HTTPS
item.description: Chrome 63 now forces all domains ending in .dev to be redirected to HTTPS and directly killed my local stack overnight.

item.title: Picking Laravel Back Up
item.description: Over the past few weeks I've finally got around to working with Laravel again. Oh, how happy I am!

item.title: How I Build WordPress Plugins: Part 1 - Framework
item.description: Part 1, Utilising a framework in the development of WordPress Plugins. A brief explanation on how I begin rapid development.

item.title: Setting Up and Using Yarn
item.description: How to set up and use Yarn (a JavaScript package manager) in replace of NPM whilst keeping your usual workflow.

item.title: Using Visual Studio Code (with 5 Recommended Extensions)
item.description: A break down of Visual Studio Code with five recommended extensions to get you up and running when moving from Sublime or Atom.

item.title: University Isn't Everything (pt. 2)
item.description: I wanted to express my thoughts on why university didn't feel all that fulfilling or stimulating with regards to moving into the Web Design Industry.
